H0.text: To fight disease in the body is the main function of red blood cells.

H1.text: To carry oxygen to all parts of the body is the main function of red blood cells.

H2.text: To remove carbon monoxide from all parts of the body is the main function of red blood cells.

H3.text: To produce materials which cause the blood to clot is the main function of red blood cells.

A4.text: Red blood cells are the vertebrate's principal means of delivering oxygen (O2) to the body tissuesâ€”via blood flow through the circulatory system.

A5.text: Hemoglobin is responsible for the transport of more than 98% of the oxygen in the body (the remaining oxygen is carried dissolved in the blood plasma).
